p: Piperine ( 1, Figure 1) is a well-known natural product that is derived from peppercorns [ 1– 3]. Many biological studies of 1 have been carried out, and these studies have led to a diverse array of biological activities being claimed for this compound [ 4– 9]. For example, 1 is reported to exhibit inhibitory activity towards both acetylcholinesterase (AChE) and β-secretase (BACE-1), which suggests that 1 could hold promise as a dual mechanism-of-action treatment for Alzheimer’s disease [ 4, 10– 13].
